member.name: T:NDceRpc.Client
member.summary: Provides a connection-based wrapper around the RPC client

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Client.Dispose
member.summary: Disconnects the client and frees any resources.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Client.connect
member.summary: Connects the client; however, this is a soft-connection and validation of the connection will not take place until the first call is attempted.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Client.AuthenticateAs(System.Net.NetworkCredential)
member.summary: Adds authentication information to the client, use the static Self to authenticate as the currently logged on Windows user.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Client.AuthenticateAs(System.String,System.Net.NetworkCredential)
member.summary: Adds authentication information to the client, use the static Self to authenticate as the currently logged on Windows user.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Client.AuthenticateAs(System.String,System.Net.NetworkCredential,NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL,NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.RPC_C_AUTHN[])
member.summary: Adds authentication information to the client, use the static Self to authenticate as the currently logged on Windows user. This overload allows you to specify the privacy level and authentication types to try. Normally these default to RPC_C_PROTECT_LEVEL_PKT_PRIVACY, and both RPC_C_AUTHN_GSS_NEGOTIATE or RPC_C_AUTHN_WINNT if that fails. If credentials is null, or is the Anonymous user, RPC_C_PROTECT_LEVEL_DEFAULT and RPC_C_AUTHN_NONE are used instead.

member.name: P:NDceRpc.Client.Protocol
member.summary: The protocol that was provided to the constructor

member.name: P:NDceRpc.Client.Anonymous
member.summary: Returns a constant NetworkCredential that represents the Anonymous user

member.name: P:NDceRpc.Client.Self
member.summary: Returns a constant NetworkCredential that represents the current Windows user

member.summary: The interface Id the service is using

member.summary: Constructs an RPC server for the given interface guid, the guid is used to identify multiple rpc servers/services within a single process.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.ExplicitBytes.ExplicitBytesServer.Execute(NDceRpc.IRpcCallInfo,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Can be over-ridden in a derived class to handle the incomming RPC request, or you can subscribe to the OnExecute event.

member.name: E:NDceRpc.ExplicitBytes.ExplicitBytesServer.OnExecute
member.summary: Allows a single subscription to this event to handle incomming requests rather than deriving from and overriding the Execute call.

member.summary: Verifies that the condition is true and if it fails constructs the specified type of exception and throws.

member.summary: Verifies that the condition is true and if it fails constructs the specified type of exception with any arguments provided and throws.

member.summary: Verifies that value is not null and returns the value or throws ArgumentNullException

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Guard.Assert(NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.RPC_STATUS)
member.summary: Asserts that the argument is set to RPC_STATUS.RPC_S_OK or throws a new exception.

member.name: T:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_EVENT
member.summary: The enumerated type describes the asynchronous notification events that an RPC application can receive.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_EVENT.RpcCallComplete
member.summary: The remote procedure call has completely executed.

members.member: Keeps trying to establish communications forever.
Tries the minimum amount of time for the network protocol being used. This value favors response time over correctness in determining whether the server is running.

Tries an average amount of time for the network protocol being used. This value gives correctness in determining whether a server is running and gives response time equal weight. This is the default value.
Tries the longest amount of time for the network protocol being used. This value favors correctness in determining whether a server is running over response time.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.Async.RPC_NOTIFICATION_TYPES.RpcNotificationTypeNone
member.summary: No notification is specified; is not initialized.

member.summary: The notification mechanism is a Windows system message.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.Async.RPC_NOTIFICATION_TYPES.RpcNotificationTypeCallback
member.summary: The notification mechanism is a function callback.

member.name: T:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_STATE
member.summary: The structure holds the state of an asynchronous remote procedure call. Used to wait for, query, reply to, or cancel asynchronous calls.

member.summary: Size of this structure, in bytes. The environment sets this member when is called. Do not modify this member.

member.summary: The run-time environment sets this member when is called. Do not modify this member.

member.summary: The run-time environment sets this member when is called. Do not modify this member.

member.summary: Reserved for use by the stubs. Do not use this member.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_STATE.UserInfo
member.summary: Use this member for any application-specific information that you want to keep track of in this structure.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_STATE.RuntimeInfo
member.summary: Reserved for use by the RPC run-time environment. Do not use this member.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_STATE.Reserved
member.summary: Reserved for compatibility with future versions, if any. Do not use this member.

member.name: T:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.InterfacRegistrationFlags
member.summary: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa373954.aspx

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.InterfacRegistrationFlags.RPC_IF_ALLOW_CALLBACKS_WITH_NO_AUTH
member.summary: When this interface flag is registered, the RPC runtime invokes the registered security callback for all calls, regardless of identity, protocol sequence, or authentication level of the client. This flag is allowed only when a security callback is registered. Note This flag is available starting with Windows XP with SP2 and Windows Server 2003 with SP1. When this flag is not set, RPC automatically filters all unauthenticated calls before they reach the security callback.

member.name: T:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.RpcProtseq

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.NativeMethods.RpcBindingSetObject(System.IntPtr,System.Guid@)
member.summary: The function sets the object UUID value in a binding handle.
member.param: Server binding into which the ObjectUuid is set.
Pointer to the UUID of the object serviced by the server specified in the Binding parameter. ObjectUuid is a unique identifier of an object to which a remote procedure call can be made.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.NativeMethods.RpcObjectSetType(System.Guid@,System.Guid@)
member.summary: The RpcObjectSetType function assigns the type of an object.
member.param: Pointer to an object UUID to associate with the type UUID in the TypeUuid parameter.
Pointer to the type UUID of the ObjUuid parameter. Specify a parameter value of NULL or a nil UUID to reset the object type to the default association of object UUID/nil-type UUID.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.NativeMethods.RpcBindingReset(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The RpcBindingReset function resets a binding handle so that the host is specified but the server on that host is unspecified.
member.returns: The call succeeded. The binding handle was invalid. This was the wrong kind of binding for the operation.

member.summary: Validates the format of the string binding handle and converts it to a binding handle. Connection is not done here either.

member.name: T:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.RPC_C_AUTHN
member.summary: The authentication service constants represent the authentication services passed to various run-time functions. The following constants are valid values for the AuthnSvc parameter. The authentication type to be used for connection, GSS_NEGOTIATE / WINNT are the most common. Be aware that GSS_NEGOTIATE is not available unless the machine is a member of a domain that is not running WinNT (or in legacy mode).
member.remarks: Specify RPC_C_AUTHN_NONE to turn off authentication for remote procedure calls made over a binding handle. When you specify RPC_C_AUTHN_DEFAULT, the RPC run-time library uses the RPC_C_AUTHN_WINNT authentication service for remote procedure calls made using the binding handle.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.RPC_C_AUTHN.RPC_C_AUTHN_NONE
member.summary: No authentication.

member.name: T:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL
member.summary: The authentication-level constants represent authentication levels passed to various run-time functions. These levels are listed in order of increasing authentication. Each new level adds to the authentication provided by the previous level. If the RPC run-time library does not support the specified level, it automatically upgrades to the next higher supported level. The protection level of the communications, is the default for authenticated communications.
member.remarks: Regardless of the value specified by the constant, ncalrpc always uses .

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Microsoft.Interop.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL_NONE
member.summary: Performs no authentication
